name: Cleansafe Maintenance
title: Cleansafe Website
subtitle: Client needed to revamp 15 year old website. The company wanted to have a user interactive website to attrack more clients and add new services offered.
code: Due to client requirements code is not public
requirements: Add Direct Email Submission and Call Features
overview: Revamp old website. Need of a cleaner and more elegant and professional page that would attract new clients to the company. Necesity of advertising new services, show areas of operation and experience.
approach: Put together a team of 4 people. Gather design ideas and create a wireframe using Adobe XD. Divide the team in subteams. One subteam in charge of html, css and foundations framework and the other subteam in charge of GoogleAPI and final integration. Approach color-coding of the site following the company's Logo color-code. Images fulfill the color-coding as well. Experience and area of operation requirements tackle together with GoogleMaps API. Map displays clickable location markers that show years of experience in the area and number of contracts. For better user experience and professionalism, a direct call and direct email feature is added to their site.

He took on our company project to update the company website to drive more customer traffic and add online capabilities for our customers. He built a new website with improved design including a highlight of all our services and an interactive map with service area coverage. He added online capabilities that allows our customers to request a cleaning service online and an online shopping cart. Mikel was committed to producing a website that met all our needs and took our feedback into consideration. I plan to use Mikel for our next project due to his knowledge, creativity and commitment to providing a quality product, in addition to being a pleasure to work with.

name: Hospice MD
title: UB04 Form suite
subtitle: Hospital located in Los Angeles needed to create a web-base database-interactive UB04 form to ensure proper billing and avoid human error on billing.
notes: Note: Live hosted on heroku to showcase. Due to heroku policies, if app has been unused for 30 min, it's put to sleep. It may take a few seconds to load.
requirements: Polished GUI that resembles paper-copy UB04
Ability to retrive and update information from the database pertaining to the specific patient
overview: Client needed a suite to act as a middle tier on billing transactions. They required the capacity of clicking a patient name and automatically generate the UB04 form pertinent to that client. On the form, all the information stored in the database from the patient should be displayed. Client needed as well the possibility to update their database directly from the UB04 Form. Finally, the client was facing a big amount of billing returns from a financial department for the mismatch of patients-to-be-billed information. It was imperative to develop a UB04 that could interact with their database and serve as a middle tier to double-check the information and avoid human error prior to submission to the financial department.
approach: The first goal was to address the UI on an html file. Once that was finished and responsive, the html file was converted into a handlebars file, which by a simple {{each}} method allowed us to create multiple pages with the same structure and different information displayed. Thus, we got dryer code. From there, all of the effort was put on the development of the proper database models for this project nature and all of the backend logic.
testimonial: As VP of Product and Application Development at HospiceMD, I was directly involved with Mikel and his team in developing a comprehensive Medical Billing Module for HospiceMD. I found him technically astute and extremely receptive to understanding key concepts and translating them into an actual deliverable. Mikel along with his team exhibited a great work ethic and professionalism. I strongly recommend Mikel as an excellent web developer.
testimonial_role: VP of Product and Application Development, HospiceMD

name: Veiramal Consultant
title: VeiraMal -- Prototype For Employee Management Suite
subtitle: HR Consulting firm located in Australia required the development of a prototype management tool that would have access to the company employees and would allow to edit or create newHire forms, employeeChange forms and termination forms.
code: Due to client requirements code is not public
notes: Note: Live hosted on heroku to showcase. Due to heroku policies, if app has been unused for 30 min, it's put to sleep. It may take a few seconds to load.
requirements: Ability to retrive, create and update information from the database pertaining to the specific employee
overview: Client was facing lot of complaints from managers and requests to automatize their employee management forms. They wanted to have a system where managers, hr department and payroll department would have live access to any change in their employees status. In order to do that they required a suite that allows them to communicate among departments, give different permissions to each department and would autocomplete specific fields. I was hired to create a prototype that they could use later on to create their own suite
approach: First I divided the project to have a plan for an MVP. I started dividing the main form on different react components. Once that was successfully achieve, I created the schema for the database and after that all routing was created and tested. From there, I moved on to populate the form, and after that was achieved for a hard coded id on the get request, I moved on using localstorage to dynamically pass the specific employee id onto the get request and do all the pertaining conditional rendering.
testimonial: We're sorry we don't have a review for this project
